meanings.definition: A vessel used to transport passengers and vehicles across a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The ferries carried cars and people across the river.
meanings.sent2: We took the ferry to reach the island.
meanings.sent3: The ferry was so full of cars, it looked like a floating parking lot!
meanings.sent4: The ferry glided gracefully through the water like a swan.
meanings.sent5: The bright red ferry stood out against the blue sea.

meanings.definition: The act of transporting passengers and vehicles across a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The ferries across the bay were always busy.
meanings.sent2: Watching the ferries come and go was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The ferries seemed to dance on the waves as they crossed.
meanings.sent4: The ferries hummed with activity as they shuttled back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ferries' horns echoed across the water.

meanings.definition: To transport passengers and vehicles across a body of water.
meanings.sent1: He ferries people to the island every day.
meanings.sent2: She ferries tourists across the lake in her boat.
meanings.sent3: The captain ferries passengers with a smile on his face.
meanings.sent4: The boat ferries commuters to the city in the morning rush.
meanings.sent5: The ferry service ferries hundreds of people daily.
